bug.author: cheyang
bug.summary: Fuse failed to restart when it's killed
bug.description:
Alluxio Version: 2.2.1 Describe the bug I use helm to install the latest chart, and kill the process of alluxio-fuse. And I'm able to see the alluxio-fuse pod is not able to restart automatically. The error is <denchmark-code>kubectl describe po alluxio-fuse-cgwgj Warning Failed 0s (x3 over 22s) kubelet, cn-huhehaote.192.168.0.118 Error: failed to start container "alluxio-fuse": Error response from daemon: error while creating mount source path '/alluxio-fuse': mkdir /alluxio-fuse: file exists </denchmark-code>
The reason is that if the hostpath/alluxio-fuse is a bad mount path due to the process alluxio-fuse doesn't exit correctly. <denchmark-code>[root@iZhp3bku0ru8vuxq08lorvZ ~]# mkdir -p /alluxio-fuse mkdir: cannot create directory ‘/alluxio-fuse’: File exists [root@iZhp3bku0ru8vuxq08lorvZ ~]# mount |grep alluxio-fuse alluxio-fuse on /alluxio-fuse type fuse.alluxio-fuse (rw,nosuid,nodev,relatime,user_id=0,group_id=0) [root@iZhp3bku0ru8vuxq08lorvZ ~]# cd /alluxio-fuse -bash: cd: /alluxio-fuse: Transport endpoint is not connected </denchmark-code>
To Reproduce Steps to reproduce the behavior (as minimally and precisely as possible) Expected behavior A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. Urgency Describe the impact and urgency of the bug. Additional context Add any other context about the problem here.
